3. Malware and ransomware attacks: Hackers can use public Wi-Fi networks to distribute malware and ransomware to unsuspecting users, which can compromise their devices and data.
4. Denial of Service (DoS) attacks: Hackers can flood a public Wi-Fi network with traffic, making it unavailable to legitimate users.
